posts.post_content:
Ok so I have had this deck that people have been talking about for a about a year. And it is fun. Loads of fun is casual. and if it goes off, it really slows the game down, just long enough so you win. Not as good in a multi player match, but it still works, unless they realize what is going on. Here is the list I use.  
  
4 [Braid of fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braid of fire)  
4 [aether flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=aether flash)  
3[reprecussion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reprecussion)  
2 [Burning Sands](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Sands)  
  
4 [Dingus Staff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dingus Staff)  
  
3 [pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pyroclasm)  
4 [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt)  
3 [skred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=skred)  
4 [searing blaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=searing blaze)  
  
4 [hunted dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hunted dragon)  
4 this  
  
4 [forbidden orchard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=forbidden orchard)  
18 snow covered mountain  
  
Often, you will win sitting with a handful of land. The orchards are nice, nothing like a uncounterable shock, or better, to the face for free, every turn.
posts.html:
Ok so I have had this deck that people have been talking about for a about a year. And it is fun. Loads of fun is casual. and if it goes off, it really slows the game down, just long enough so you win. Not as good in a multi player match, but it still works, unless they realize what is going on. Here is the list I use.

4 Braid of fire
4 aether flash
3reprecussion
2 Burning Sands

4 Dingus Staff

3 pyroclasm
4 lightning bolt
3 skred
4 searing blaze

4 hunted dragon
4 this

4 forbidden orchard
18 snow covered mountain

Often, you will win sitting with a handful of land. The orchards are nice, nothing like a uncounterable shock, or better, to the face for free, every turn.

Posted By: littlebeast (2/1/2010 9:59:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The *Grand Creature Type Update* apparently forgot about that card: A "*Survivor*" token?  
Being a survivor is a condition, neither a race nor a profession.  
What about "*Put a 1/1 red **Human creature token named Survivor** onto the battlefield under an opponent's control.*" instead?  
  
Aside from that it's a decent card and possibly the only one that can actually make good use of its rampage ability, which is normally a minor advantage.  
  
It's even more fun when used along with [Tainted AEther](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted AEther).  
Cards like [Goblin Sharpshooter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Sharpshooter) or [AEther Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=AEther Flash) also do a good job with this card to get rid of them.  
Play both or add a [Blood Seeker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Seeker) or [Burning Sands](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Sands) to get your opponent into some decent trouble.
posts.html:
The Grand Creature Type Update apparently forgot about that card: A "Survivor" token?
Being a survivor is a condition, neither a race nor a profession.
What about "Put a 1/1 red Human creature token named Survivor onto the battlefield under an opponent's control." instead?

Aside from that it's a decent card and possibly the only one that can actually make good use of its rampage ability, which is normally a minor advantage.

It's even more fun when used along with Tainted AEther.
Cards like Goblin Sharpshooter or AEther Flash also do a good job with this card to get rid of them.
Play both or add a Blood Seeker or Burning Sands to get your opponent into some decent trouble.

posts.post_content: They need to update the rulings on this card, after M10, according to rule 110.5a Tokens are owned *and* controlled by the player under whose control they entered the battlefield. I had a [Brand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brand) deck that used to kick everyone's ass with this card, but now it doesn't work. Just saying, they should've updated the rulings for this card, and I also would love to see a printed Survivor Token card.
posts.html:
They need to update the rulings on this card, after M10, according to rule 110.5a Tokens are owned and controlled by the player under whose control they entered the battlefield. Just saying, they should've updated the rulings for this card, and I also would love to see a printed Survivor Token card.

posts.post_content:
He is a Powerhouse!  
Got a Deck with him in it, works quite well:  
  
it is U/R and uses   
[Earthquake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earthquake),[forbidden orchard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=forbidden orchard), [Hissing Iguanar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hissing Iguanar), [Serum Powder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serum Powder), [Dingus Staff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dingus Staff), [Hunted Phantasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Hunted Phantasm), [Leyline of Singularity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Singularity), [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder), [thirst for Knowledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thirst for Knowledge), [Hunted Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunted Dragon) Artifact-, duallands and Basics  
  
With Serum Powder you pretty surely have a free Leyline out Round zero, which makes the upkeep costs of Varchild irrelevant (at first). To have Cardquality and a spell for Round one Ponder lets you look that you get nothing double or three times.  
  
After that you play Varchild, which is a supereffective beater for 2 Mana.  
  
Round three you either dig deeper with thirst and discard your double Dingusstaff or one of the many artifactlands to get a huge Cardadvantage, or you can get Hissing Iguanar out and turn... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
He is a Powerhouse!
Got a Deck with him in it, works quite well:

it is U/R and uses
Earthquake,forbidden orchard, Hissing Iguanar, Serum Powder, Dingus Staff, Hunted Phantasm, Leyline of Singularity, Ponder, thirst for Knowledge, Hunted Dragon Artifact-, duallands and Basics

With Serum Powder you pretty surely have a free Leyline out Round zero, which makes the upkeep costs of Varchild irrelevant (at first). To have Cardquality and a spell for Round one Ponder lets you look that you get nothing double or three times.

After that you play Varchild, which is a supereffective beater for 2 Mana.

Round three you either dig deeper with thirst and discard your double Dingusstaff or one of the many artifactlands to get a huge Cardadvantage, or you can get Hissing Iguanar out and turn... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Here is a deck:  
  
[Powerstone Minefield](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Powerstone Minefield), [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon) and [Paladin en-Vec](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paladin en-Vec). Fill it in from there. It's situational but rampage is cherry on the top because if someone has two creatures big enough to survive the Minefield.   
  
Say what you will about the War-Riders I guess, but at least it's a interesting card.   
  
4/5
